get.description:
The job scheduler feature facilitates us to schedule a job to be
executed in the near future.  Currently, only non-interactive enable
and configuration commands are allowed to be configured as a job.
Schedules can be configured to be triggered periodically or at a specific
calendar date and time. They are categorized into periodic schedules,
calendar schedules, and one-shot schedules. Periodic schedules are based
on the fixed time interval between the two triggers.

Calendar schedules are based on the specified days of the week and days
of the month. Calendar schedules are therefore aware of the notion of
months, days, weekdays, hours, and minutes.

One-shot schedules are similar to the calendar schedule but they will
automatically disable themselves after one trigger.

This feature is useful to schedule a toggling port, check the system
health status, clear the statistics or some clean-up activities,
QoS policy changes, save the configurations, and other similar jobs.

While updating trigger-type other parameter must set to null, which are
not applicable.

post.summary: Create a new schedule by unique name

delete_object_type.name: object_type
delete_object_type.description: LOCAL - To delete local objects. SHARED - To delete shared objects. Default - Defaults to SHARED if not provided

delete_scope_id.name: scope_id
delete_scope_id.description: Scope at which local object needs to be deleted. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

delete_persona.name: persona
delete_persona.description: Persona for which the local object needs to be deleted. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

post_object_type.name: object_type
post_object_type.description: LOCAL - To create local objects. SHARED - To create shared objects. Default - Defaults to SHARED if not provided

post_scope_id.name: scope_id
post_scope_id.description: Scope at which local object needs to be created. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

post_persona.name: persona
post_persona.description: Persona for which the local object needs to be created. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

patch_object_type.name: object_type
patch_object_type.description: LOCAL - To update local objects. SHARED - To update shared objects. Default - Defaults to SHARED if not provided

patch_scope_id.name: scope_id
patch_scope_id.description: Scope at which local object needs to be updated. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

patch_persona.name: persona
patch_persona.description: Persona for which the local object needs to be updated. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

get_object_type.name: object_type
get_object_type.description: Retrieves LOCAL or SHARED or both(default) configuration objects.

get_scope_id.name: scope_id
get_scope_id.description: Configuration at a given scope. Mandatory for view_type = LOCAL.

get_persona.name: persona
get_persona.description: Filters configuration specific to given persona type. If not provided and view_type = LOCAL, then defaults to all persona.

effective.name: effective
effective.description: True - Returns effective configuration (i.e hierarchically merged configuration). False - Returns committed configuration at a given scope.

detailed.name: detailed
detailed.description: True - Includes annotations in the returned json to indicate the type of object, scope, and persona. False - Returns only config objects without annotations.

view_type.name: view_type
view_type.description: LIBRARY - Returns shared objects in library. For LIBRARY, all other parameters listed below, except 'detailed' , will be ignored. LOCAL - Returns configurations for a scope and one or more persona based on parameters below.

schema.description: The number of requests left for the time window.

X-RateLimit-Remaining.description: The number of requests left for the time window.

schema.description: The UTC date/time at which the current rate limit window resets.

X-RateLimit-Reset.description: The UTC date/time at which the current rate limit window resets.

ArubaJobScheduler_JobSchedulerSchema.description:
The job scheduler feature facilitates us to schedule a job to be
executed in the near future.  Currently, only non-interactive enable
and configuration commands are allowed to be configured as a job.
Schedules can be configured to be triggered periodically or at a specific
calendar date and time. They are categorized into periodic schedules,
calendar schedules, and one-shot schedules. Periodic schedules are based
on the fixed time interval between the two triggers.

Calendar schedules are based on the specified days of the week and days
of the month. Calendar schedules are therefore aware of the notion of
months, days, weekdays, hours, and minutes.

One-shot schedules are similar to the calendar schedule but they will
automatically disable themselves after one trigger.

This feature is useful to schedule a toggling port, check the system
health status, clear the statistics or some clean-up activities,
QoS policy changes, save the configurations, and other similar jobs.

While updating trigger-type other parameter must set to null, which are
not applicable.

ANY.description: Any of local or shared config object.

cli-command.description: CLI command that needs to be executed when the job is scheduled.

cli-delay.description:
Delay in seconds that the system will wait after executing
the current CLI command.

x-enumDescriptions.CLI: Set of CLI commands are defined as job.

frequency.description: Frequency of job scheduler calendar time on schedule.

week-day.description: Day in a week. week-day is valid when frequency is WEEKLY

items.description: Days of the week, separated by range.

month-day.description: Date in a month. month-day is valid when frequency is MONTHLY.

yearly-date.description: The date when the job should run, in MM/DD format.

start-date-at.x-typeDescription:
A full UTC date, expressed in the format described in RFC3339.
That is to say:

YYYY-MM-DD

where YYYY is the year, MM is the month expressed as a two-digit
month (zero padding if required), DD is the day of the month,
expressed as a two digit value.
start-date-at.description:
Trigger start date, expressed as YYYY-MM-DD .
start-date-at is valid when trigger-type is TRIGGER_AT and start-time-at
is configured.

start-time-at.description:
Trigger start time. 24-hour time, expressed as HH:MM .
start-time-at is valid when trigger-type is TRIGGER_AT

start-time-on.description:
Trigger start time. 24-hour time, expressed as HH:MM .
start-time-on is valid when trigger-type is TRIGGER_ON

start-date-on.x-typeDescription:
A full UTC date, expressed in the format described in RFC3339.
That is to say:

YYYY-MM-DD

where YYYY is the year, MM is the month expressed as a two-digit
month (zero padding if required), DD is the day of the month,
expressed as a two digit value.
start-date-on.description:
Trigger start date, expressed as YYYY-MM-DD .
start-date-on is valid when trigger-type is TRIGGER_ON

start-date-every.x-typeDescription:
A full UTC date, expressed in the format described in RFC3339.
That is to say:

YYYY-MM-DD

where YYYY is the year, MM is the month expressed as a two-digit
month (zero padding if required), DD is the day of the month,
expressed as a two digit value.
start-date-every.description:
Trigger start date, expressed as YYYY-MM-DD .
start-date-every is valid when trigger-type is TRIGGER_EVERY and
start-time-every is configured.

start-time-every.description:
Trigger start time. 24-hour time, expressed as HH:MM .
start-time-every is valid when /trigger-type is TRIGGER_EVERY.

days.description: Days. days is valid when trigger-type is TRIGGER_EVERY.

hours.description: Hours. hours is valid when trigger-type is TRIGGER_EVERY.

minutes.description: Minutes. minutes is valid when trigger-type is TRIGGER_EVERY.

x-enumDescriptions.TRIGGER_AT: Fixed date and time for the schedule. This is oneshot schedule.
x-enumDescriptions.TRIGGER_EVERY: Periodic interval for schedule with custom time interval.
x-enumDescriptions.TRIGGER_EVENT: Event at which the job is triggered.

trigger-type.description:
Trigger type.
While updating trigger-type other parameter must set to null, which are
not applicable.

count.description:
Maximum number of times the schedule can trigger.
If not set, no limit is applied on the number of triggers.
This is not applicable for 'one-shot' schedule type.
Once schedule is triggered count number of times, the status
changes to expired.

date-time.x-typeDescription:
A date and time, expressed in the format described in RFC3339.
That is to say:

YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ+-hh:mm

where YYYY is the year, MM is the month expressed as a two-digit
month (zero padding if required), DD is the day of the month,
expressed as a two digit value. T is the literal character 'T',
HH is the hour of the day expressed as a two digit number, using
the 24-hour clock, MM is the minute of the hour expressed as a
two digit number. Z is the literal character 'Z', followed by a
timezone offset expressed in hours (hh) and minutes (mm), both
expressed as two digit numbers. The time offset is specified as
a positive or negative offset to UTC using the '+' or '-'
character preceding the offset.

Optionally, fractional seconds can be expressed after the minute
of the hour as a decimal number of unspecified precision
reflecting fractions of a second.

trigger-at-event.description: Runs the job when the event occur.

x-enumDescriptions.TRIGGER_AT: Fixed date and time for the schedule. This is oneshot schedule.
x-enumDescriptions.TRIGGER_EVERY: Periodic interval for schedule with custom time interval.
x-enumDescriptions.TRIGGER_EVENT: Event at which the job is triggered.

trigger-at.description:
Trigger at given time.
trigger-at is valid when trigger-type is TRIGGER_AT.

x-enumDescriptions.TRIGGER_AT: Fixed date and time for the schedule. This is oneshot schedule.
x-enumDescriptions.TRIGGER_EVERY: Periodic interval for schedule with custom time interval.
x-enumDescriptions.TRIGGER_EVENT: Event at which the job is triggered.

trigger-on.description:
Trigger on given date and time.
trigger-on is valid when trigger-type is TRIGGER_ON.

trigger-on-weekly.description: Trigger type weekly. trigger-on-weekly is valid when frequency is WEEKLY.

trigger-on-monthly.description: Trigger type monthly. trigger-on-monthly is valid when frequency is MONTHLY.

trigger-on-yearly.description: Trigger type yearly. trigger-on-yearly is valid when frequency is YEARLY.

x-enumDescriptions.TRIGGER_AT: Fixed date and time for the schedule. This is oneshot schedule.
x-enumDescriptions.TRIGGER_EVERY: Periodic interval for schedule with custom time interval.
x-enumDescriptions.TRIGGER_EVENT: Event at which the job is triggered.

trigger-every.description:
Trigger every peoriodic interval. trigger-every is valid when
trigger-type is TRIGGER_EVERY.

cli-command.description: Command to execute when this job runs.

config-save.description: Save the running configuration to flash after the job completes.

Successful200.description: Success response returned from the server.

Error400.description: Error details returned from the server.

message.example: Bad request. Invalid values supplied in request.

Error401.description: Error details returned from the server.

Error403.description: Error details returned from the server.

Error404.description: Error details returned from the server.

message.example: Not found. Yang / Corresponding Rule is missing.

Error406.description: Error details returned from the server.

Error408.description: Error details returned from the server.

Error412.description: Error details returned from the server.

Error429.description: Error details returned from the server.

Error500.description: Error details returned from the server.
